title: Archeologist/SLASH'EM
data:
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [ ]## Contents* [1 Starting equipment](#Starting_equipment)
* [2 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
* [3 Attributes](#Attributes)

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the **Archeologist** is one of the [roles](/wiki/Role "Role") from *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that is available to the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero").

Archeologists can be of [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") or [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment"), and can be a [human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"), [dwarf](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)"), [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)"), [doppelganger](/wiki/Doppelganger_\(starting_race\) "Doppelganger (starting race)"), [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"), or [hobbit](/wiki/Hobbit_\(starting_race\) "Hobbit (starting race)").

## Starting equipment

Each Archeologist starts with the following equipment:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- +2 [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip") ([wielded](/wiki/Wielded "Wielded"))

- +0 [leather jacket](/wiki/Leather_jacket "Leather jacket")

- +0 [fedora](/wiki/Fedora "Fedora")

- 3 to 6 uncursed [food rations](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration")

- a random blessed [spellbook](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook") for one of the following spells:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

  - [detect food](/wiki/Spellbook_of_detect_food "Spellbook of detect food")
  - [detect monsters](/wiki/Spellbook_of_detect_monsters "Spellbook of detect monsters")
  - [light](/wiki/Spellbook_of_light "Spellbook of light")
  - [knock](/wiki/Spellbook_of_knock "Spellbook of knock")
  - [wizard lock](/wiki/Spellbook_of_wizard_lock "Spellbook of wizard lock")

- 2 stacks of 1-2 random scrolls

- +0 uncursed [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") (alternate weapon)

- uncursed [tinning kit](/wiki/Tinning_kit "Tinning kit") (30 to 99 charges)

- uncursed [touchstone](/wiki/Touchstone "Touchstone")

- uncursed [sack](/wiki/Sack "Sack")

- One of the following:[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

  - uncursed [blindfold](/wiki/Blindfold "Blindfold") (1⁄4 chance or 25% overall), otherwise;
  - uncursed [towel](/wiki/Towel "Towel") (1⁄4 chance or 18.75% overall)

- uncursed [leash](/wiki/Leash "Leash") (1⁄4 chance or 25%)

- One of the following:[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

  - uncursed [tin opener](/wiki/Tin_opener "Tin opener") (1⁄4 chance or 25%), otherwise;
  - uncursed [oil lamp](/wiki/Oil_lamp "Oil lamp") or uncursed [torch](/wiki/Torch "Torch") (equal probability of each)

- uncursed [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker") (1⁄8 chance or 12.5%)

The Archeologist's default starting [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") is a [little dog](/wiki/Little_dog "Little dog") or [kitten](/wiki/Kitten "Kitten") with equal probability.

## Intrinsics

Archeologists gain the following abilities upon reaching the following [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

- XL 1: [Stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth")
- XL 1: [Speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")
- XL 10: [Searching](/wiki/Automatic_searching "Automatic searching")

## Attributes

The Archeologist's starting [attributes](/wiki/Attribute "Attribute") are distributed as follows:[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

| Attributes                 | [Strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") | [Dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity") | [Constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution") | [Intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence") | [Wisdom](/wiki/Wisdom "Wisdom") | [Charisma](/wiki/Charisma "Charisma") | Remaining |
| -------------------------- | ------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------- | ------------------------------------- | --------- |
| Minimum attributes         | 7                                     | 7                                        | 7                                                 | 10                                                | 10                              | 7                                     | 27        |
| Distribution percentages   | 20%                                   | 10%                                      | 20%                                               | 20%                                               | 20%                             | 10%                                   |           |
| Mean w/ standard deviation | 12.79±2.15                            | 9.78±1.63                                | 12.50±2.10                                        | 15.34±1.86                                        | 15.34±1.86                      | 9.51±1.57                             |           |

## Skills

Archeologists have the following [skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill") available to them:[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

| Archeologist skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max                 | [Skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Basic               | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [paddle](/wiki/Paddle "Paddle"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart")
- *Combat:* [two weapon combat](/wiki/Two_weapon_combat "Two weapon combat")
- *Spells:* [attack](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Attack_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)"), [healing](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Healing_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)"), [enchantment](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Enchantment_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)"), [protection](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Protection_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)"), [body](/wiki/Body_spells "Body spells") |
| Skilled             | * *Weapons:* [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"), [firearm](/wiki/Firearm "Firearm"), [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling"), [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")
* *Spells:* [matter](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Matter_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| Expert              | - *Weapons:* [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe"), [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber"), [boomerang](/wiki/Boomerang "Boomerang"), [whip](/wiki/Whip "Whip")
- *Combat:* [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands")
- *Spells:* [divination](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Divination_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |

Archeologists start with *Basic* skill level in whips, pick-axes and slings (since touchstones are classed as [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling") ammo), along with *Basic* skill in either matter or divination spells depending on the starting spellbook.

## Techniques

Archeologists can learn the [disarm](/wiki/Disarm "Disarm") [technique](/wiki/Technique "Technique") by reaching Skilled in any weapon, and also gain the following techniques:[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

|           |                                       |
| --------- | ------------------------------------- |
| **Level** | **Technique**                         |
| 1         | [Research](/wiki/Research "Research") |

## Special rules

Archeologists can [apply](/wiki/Apply "Apply") uncursed [touchstones](/wiki/Touchstone "Touchstone") as if they were blessed to formally identify any [gem](/wiki/Gem "Gem").

Archeologists suffer a −1 penalty to [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") for breaking a [historic statue](/wiki/Historic_statue "Historic statue").

Non-chaotic archeologists suffer a −3 penalty to alignment record for digging up a [headstone](/wiki/Headstone "Headstone"), while chaotic archeologists get a +3 bonus for doing the game.

A [fedora](/wiki/Fedora "Fedora") [worn](/wiki/Worn "Worn") by an Archeologist gives a +1 [charisma](/wiki/Charisma "Charisma") bonus and [acts as a luckstone](/wiki/Luck_item "Luck item").

## Rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

- XL 1–2: Digger
- XL 3–5: Field Worker
- XL 6–9: Investigator
- XL 10–13: Exhumer
- XL 14–17: Excavator
- XL 18–21: Spelunker
- XL 22–25: Speleologist
- XL 26–29: Collector
- XL 30: Curator

## Gods

- *Main article: [Religion](/wiki/Religion "Religion")*

The Archeologist pantheon is based on Central American mythology, specifically the Aztecs.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)

- Lawful: [Quetzalcoatl](/wiki/Quetzalcoatl "Quetzalcoatl")
- Neutral: [Camaxtli](/wiki/Camaxtli "Camaxtli")
- Chaotic: [Huhetotl](/wiki/Huhetotl "Huhetotl")

## Quest

- *Main article: [Archeologist quest](/wiki/Archeologist_quest "Archeologist quest")*

The Archeologist quest sees an Archeologist fight [The Minion of Huhetotl](/wiki/The_Minion_of_Huhetotl "The Minion of Huhetotl") for [The Orb of Detection](/wiki/The_Orb_of_Detection "The Orb of Detection"), an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [crystal ball](/wiki/Crystal_ball "Crystal ball"). While carried, it confers [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") and [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage"), and can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") to toggle [invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility") on or off.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Establish role strategy, detail to match the layout of other NetHack/SLASH'EM role strategy sections and distinguish it from those."*

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [u\_init.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 28](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/u_init.c#line28 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/u init.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [u\_init.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1015](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/u_init.c#line1015 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/u init.c")
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [u\_init.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1024](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/u_init.c#line1024 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/u init.c")
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [u\_init.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1028](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/u_init.c#line1028 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/u init.c")
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [attrib.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 29](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/attrib.c#line29 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/attrib.c")
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [role.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 49](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/role.c#line49 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/role.c")

8. [↑](#cite_ref-8) [tech.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 88](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/tech.c#line88 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/tech.c")
9. [↑](#cite_ref-9) [role.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 28](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/role.c#line28 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/role.c")
10. [↑](#cite_ref-10) [role.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 38](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/role.c#line38 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/role.c")

Archeologist/SLASH'EM

From NetHackWiki
< Archeologist
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Contents

  • 1 Starting equipment
  • 2 Intrinsics
  • 3 Attributes
  • 4 Skills
  • 5 Techniques
  • 6 Special rules
  • 7 Rank titles
  • 8 Gods
  • 9 Quest
  • 10 References

In SLASH'EM, the Archeologist is one of the roles from NetHack that is available to the hero.

Archeologists can be of lawful or neutral alignment, and can be a human, dwarf, gnome, doppelganger, elf, or hobbit.

Starting equipment

Each Archeologist starts with the following equipment:[1]

  • +2 bullwhip (wielded)
  • +0 leather jacket
  • +0 fedora
  • 3 to 6 uncursed food rations
  • a random blessed spellbook for one of the following spells:[2]
    • detect food
    • detect monsters
    • light
    • knock
    • wizard lock
  • 2 stacks of 1-2 random scrolls
  • +0 uncursed pick-axe (alternate weapon)
  • uncursed tinning kit (30 to 99 charges)
  • uncursed touchstone
  • uncursed sack
  • One of the following:[3]
    • uncursed blindfold (1⁄4 chance or 25% overall), otherwise;
    • uncursed towel (1⁄4 chance or 18.75% overall)
  • uncursed leash (1⁄4 chance or 25%)
  • One of the following:[4]
    • uncursed tin opener (1⁄4 chance or 25%), otherwise;
    • uncursed oil lamp or uncursed torch (equal probability of each)
  • uncursed magic marker (1⁄8 chance or 12.5%)

The Archeologist's default starting pet is a little dog or kitten with equal probability.

Intrinsics

Archeologists gain the following abilities upon reaching the following experience levels:[5]

  • XL 1: Stealth
  • XL 1: Speed
  • XL 10: Searching

Attributes

The Archeologist's starting attributes are distributed as follows:[6]

Attributes Strength Dexterity Constitution Intelligence Wisdom Charisma Remaining
Minimum attributes 7 7 7 10 10 7 27
Distribution percentages 20% 10% 20% 20% 20% 10%
Mean w/ standard deviation 12.79±2.15 9.78±1.63 12.50±2.10 15.34±1.86 15.34±1.86 9.51±1.57

Skills

Archeologists have the following skills available to them:[7]

Archeologist skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: dagger, knife, short sword, paddle, dart
  • Combat: two weapon combat
  • Spells: attack, healing, enchantment, protection, body
Skilled
  • Weapons: scimitar, club, quarterstaff, firearm, sling, unicorn horn
  • Spells: matter
Expert
  • Weapons: pick-axe, saber, boomerang, whip
  • Combat: bare hands
  • Spells: divination

Archeologists start with Basic skill level in whips, pick-axes and slings (since touchstones are classed as sling ammo), along with Basic skill in either matter or divination spells depending on the starting spellbook.

Techniques

Archeologists can learn the disarm technique by reaching Skilled in any weapon, and also gain the following techniques:[8]

Level Technique
1 Research

Special rules

Archeologists can apply uncursed touchstones as if they were blessed to formally identify any gem.

Archeologists suffer a −1 penalty to alignment record for breaking a historic statue.

Non-chaotic archeologists suffer a −3 penalty to alignment record for digging up a headstone, while chaotic archeologists get a +3 bonus for doing the game.

A fedora worn by an Archeologist gives a +1 charisma bonus and acts as a luckstone.

Rank titles

The status line shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:[9]

  • XL 1–2: Digger
  • XL 3–5: Field Worker
  • XL 6–9: Investigator
  • XL 10–13: Exhumer
  • XL 14–17: Excavator
  • XL 18–21: Spelunker
  • XL 22–25: Speleologist
  • XL 26–29: Collector
  • XL 30: Curator

Gods

Main article: Religion

The Archeologist pantheon is based on Central American mythology, specifically the Aztecs.[10]

  • Lawful: Quetzalcoatl
  • Neutral: Camaxtli
  • Chaotic: Huhetotl

Quest

Main article: Archeologist quest

The Archeologist quest sees an Archeologist fight The Minion of Huhetotl for The Orb of Detection, an artifact crystal ball. While carried, it confers magic resistance, telepathy and half spell damage, and can be invoked to toggle invisibility on or off.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Establish role strategy, detail to match the layout of other NetHack/SLASH'EM role strategy sections and distinguish it from those."

rawPage:
{{tocright}}
In [[SLASH'EM]], the '''Archeologist''' is one of the [[role]]s from ''[[NetHack]]'' that is available to the [[hero]].

Archeologists can be of [[lawful]] or [[neutral]] [[alignment]], and can be a [[Human (starting race)|human]], [[Dwarf (starting race)|dwarf]], [[Gnome (starting race)|gnome]], [[Doppelganger (starting race)|doppelganger]], [[Elf (starting race)|elf]], or [[Hobbit (starting race)|hobbit]].

==Starting equipment==
Each Archeologist starts with the following equipment:{{refsrc|u_init.c|28|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

* +2 [[bullwhip]] ([[wielded]])
* +0 [[leather jacket]]
* +0 [[fedora]]
* 3 to 6 uncursed [[food ration]]s
* a random blessed [[spellbook]] for one of the following spells:{{refsrc|u_init.c|1015|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}
** {{Spell of|detect food}}
** {{Spell of|detect monsters}}
** {{Spell of|light}}
** {{Spell of|knock}}
** {{Spell of|wizard lock}}
* 2 stacks of 1-2 random scrolls
* +0 uncursed [[pick-axe]] (alternate weapon)
* uncursed [[tinning kit]] (30 to 99 charges)
* uncursed [[touchstone]]
* uncursed [[sack]]
* One of the following:{{refsrc|u_init.c|1024|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}
** uncursed [[blindfold]] ({{frac|4}} chance or 25% overall), otherwise;
** uncursed [[towel]] ({{frac|4}} chance or 18.75% overall)
* uncursed [[leash]] ({{frac|4}} chance or 25%)
* One of the following:{{refsrc|u_init.c|1028|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}
** uncursed [[tin opener]] ({{frac|4}} chance or 25%), otherwise;
** uncursed [[oil lamp]] or uncursed [[torch]] (equal probability of each)
* uncursed [[magic marker]] ({{frac|8}} chance or 12.5%)

The Archeologist's default starting [[pet]] is a [[little dog]] or [[kitten]] with equal probability.

==Intrinsics==
Archeologists gain the following abilities upon reaching the following [[experience level]]s:{{refsrc|attrib.c|29|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

*XL 1: [[Stealth]]
*XL 1: [[Speed]]
*XL 10: [[Automatic searching|Searching]]

==Attributes==
The Archeologist's starting [[attribute]]s are distributed as follows:{{refsrc|role.c|49|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

{| class="prettytable"
!| Attributes || [[Strength]] ||  [[Dexterity]] || [[Constitution]] ||[[Intelligence]] || [[Wisdom]] || [[Charisma]] || Remaining
|-
| Minimum attributes         || 7   || 7   || 7   || 10   || 10   || 7   || 27
|-
| Distribution percentages   || 20% || 10% || 20% || 20%  || 20%  || 10% || 
|-
| Mean w/ standard deviation || 12.79±2.15 || 9.78±1.63 || 12.50±2.10 || 15.34±1.86 || 15.34±1.86 || 9.51±1.57 ||  
|}

==Skills==
Archeologists have the following [[skill]]s available to them:{{refsrc|role.c|28|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}
{{Archeologist skill table (SLASH'EM)}}

Archeologists start with ''Basic'' skill level in whips, pick-axes and slings (since touchstones are classed as [[sling]] ammo), along with ''Basic'' skill in either matter or divination spells depending on the starting spellbook.

==Techniques==
Archeologists can learn the [[disarm]] [[technique]] by reaching Skilled in any weapon, and also gain the following techniques:{{refsrc|tech.c|88|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

{|class="prettytable"
|'''Level'''
|'''Technique'''

|1
|[[Research]]
|}

==Special rules==
Archeologists can [[apply]] uncursed [[touchstone]]s as if they were blessed to formally identify any [[gem]].

Archeologists suffer a −1 penalty to [[alignment record]] for breaking a [[historic statue]].

Non-chaotic archeologists suffer a −3 penalty to alignment record for digging up a [[headstone]], while chaotic archeologists get a +3 bonus for doing the game.

A [[fedora]] [[worn]] by an Archeologist gives a +1 [[charisma]] bonus and [[Luck item|acts as a luckstone]].

==Rank titles==
The [[status line]] shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:{{refsrc|role.c|28|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

*XL 1–2: Digger
*XL 3–5: Field Worker
*XL 6–9: Investigator
*XL 10–13: Exhumer
*XL 14–17: Excavator
*XL 18–21: Spelunker
*XL 22–25: Speleologist
*XL 26–29: Collector
*XL 30: Curator

==Gods==
{{main|Religion}}
The Archeologist pantheon is based on Central American mythology, specifically the Aztecs.{{refsrc|role.c|38|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

* Lawful:  [[Quetzalcoatl]]
* Neutral: [[Camaxtli]]
* Chaotic: [[Huhetotl]]

==Quest==
{{main|Archeologist quest}}
The Archeologist quest sees an Archeologist fight [[The Minion of Huhetotl]] for [[The Orb of Detection]], an [[artifact]] [[crystal ball]]. While carried, it confers [[magic resistance]], [[telepathy]] and [[half spell damage]], and can be [[invoked]] to toggle [[invisibility]] on or off.

==References==
<references/>
{{slashem-7E7}}
[[Category:SLASH'EM roles]]
